title: The Issue of tanks: When Are we getting another one and when will tanks be reworked?.
body: Hey All. I understand that some tanks are up-to-date like Shen and rework taric(if you can call him a tank) but the fact of the matter is that many tanks are of an old school design of dealing magic damage and having high radio's when they are meant to tank, leading to the likes of AP Rammus, Maokai and Malphite. Don't get me wrong. I do think that tanks are ok at the moment, but i still think that they need some kind of rework in the future to prevent the game being all about the damage dealers.

I disagree with this to an extent.

For me, a tank is as much about building tankiness to survive taking a lot of damage as it is having abilities to allow it to survive for longer as well.

Basically, having lots of CC that allows you to prevent an enemy ADC/APC from dealing a lot of damage will make you survive longer, and thus makes you "tankier". 

Further, a lot of tanks have armor/mr/health steroids in their kit. Leona has an Armor/MR boost, Malphite has a health shield, Tahm Kench has a health shield, Braum blocks projectiles, Maokai heals on auto attacks after spell casts, etc... 

Combine this with CC, and even without tank items these tanks can survive a lot longer than your typical squishy. They may not be AS well defined, but they're still there.

That isn't to say that there aren't issues with tanks that need to be addressed - short of putting a taunt in every tanks kit there isn't a reliable way to let them really do their job of, well, tanking damage. CC is a good answer to that (just stop the damage outright and have the tankiness to be able to go in and do it) but there's probably still room for some innovative thinking to make it better.

Assassins tend to have certain skill sets. They are mobile and bursty, and often have some clutch mitigation tool.

Tanks tend to have certain skill sets. They are disruptive (usually with CC), they usually have some skill that helps them soak additional damage, and they usually have a skill or two that encourages enemies to focus them.

Malphite, Sejuani, and Amumu all have some kind of initiation, multiple CC skills, and a big AoE lockdown on their ultimates. That's no a coincidence. They all features those because they are all traditional tanks. 

>A Vayne can go full ap or full tank but she still remains an adc (just a much much weaker one)

An sejuani who builds straight AD is still a tank. She's just a weaker one.

They probably aren't the highest priority for a class update at the moment. I could see them after assassins (so if assassins are the preseason, tanks would be mid season 7) but diving fighters might get that slot (as a tank player, I hope not). 

I'm not sure what they'd try to do for a tank update though. Items will be a tough job since pretty much any item good on a tank is great on a juggernaut (which are usually the first type of champions to bring frustration with these items) which they may want to avoid. 

They might cut the early game strengths of tanks down (I think a lot of older tanks are pretty durable early game) to follow the example of Shen and Sion: two tanks with rather low base stats for their jobs. This is balanced by their self defensive abilities (shields mainly) and also encourages them to build tanky in order to become tanky. 

%health damage might become more common on tanks (it's not exactly uncommon though) because it helps keep their damage relevant without building damage (or they will have damage scaling with health like Sion, Shen, Tahm, or Braum). I get that people hate getting killed by tanks and want tanks to do no damage, but that wouldn't promote tanks to be played. Tanks need farm and if they can't farm decently then they can't buy items, this is more important to tank junglers, who would need some decent clear times. 

Tanks should never do damage on the level of carries. And I haven't seen them do that anyway. For a tank to be as damaging as a carry, they'd be able to destroy other tanks 1v1 relatively quickly because that's what high damage is. It doesn't take much to actually kill a squishy carry that has no sustain (which isn't uncommon early game because they will rush a crit item first most of the time) and isn't kiting (which is difficult depending on the champion and/or level of the champion. Late game Lucian and Vayne are going to kite like made due to their mobility, but immobile adc (like Twitch or Fortune) require good positioning knowledge to be able to kite at all stages of the game). 

There's also making the tanks unique. Again, there are people who hate the design philosophy of specialization since it feels like it shoehorns a champion into a role (like supports being stuck in bot). But that needs to happen on some level because it encourages champion diversity. 

Take MSI. Top lane was Tank Ekko, Poppy, and Maokai. Their were no other tanks that were better picks because those tanks were pretty much masters of all. Generalists are fine, except when they do the job of the specialist better on top of doing other things. 

Ex:Why tank Sion if Malphite provides better engage?   

These are just my thoughts on tanks.

I made an Idea post about how I would to balance offensive and defensive items and stats. So check out the link if you feel like it: 

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/tA378KN3-balance-issue-tank-assassins-and-balancing-offense-and-defense

The reason that champions like Mao, Rammus, and Malph are going AP is because most of the "pure tank items" are not only not cost efficient, but get super outscaled by damage (particularly the penetration items). 

This leads to a situation where they're entirely dependent on their team for damage, while being easy kills late game due to the new penetration items. In this sense, it's much more efficient to build damage and rely on early game base damage so they can actually help carry a game. Anything less just makes them a CC bot, which can potentially make the game a 4v5 unless every damage dealer does their job well.  

The tank situation in LoL is the same as in FFXIV, if a tank isn't capable of decent dps, you're better off picking something else, which is why Warrior and Dark Knight are picked over Paladin in nearly all situations. Tanks have to be capable of at least some level of threatening damage in order to not be outclassed by bruisers and assassins building like bruisers.

I have seen a lot people having different opinions about tanks what their core function is. well, on paper they are meant to be defenders that soak up damage will being a threat to the enemy team, how? that depends on each champion in the game as none of them are the same. A good argument I saw here was about the Vanguards and the Wardens, with the former being the ones that jump into the enemy team and fucks shit up or the wardens that peel and zone up their enemies and pick them off if they break formation.

Now, you may wonder what is the difference between a tank and a juggernaut? Well correct me if i am wrong, but juggs have more damage in their kit and some defensive abilities but little proper tank utility, Darius's E has a long CD, Garen's Silence is short and single target etc. 

Tanks on the other hand have something affect a team fight which makes them a threat, Rammus being a Vanguard based tank, has good damage, a defensive steroid, a taunt and an ult that deals serious damage. but what is his trade off?, Too focus on Armor= damage and his CC is not as good as other tanks. Malphite a lot of ways to annoy the enemy team, Q steals speed, W deals AoE damage and his E slows while his ult crashes the party.
Braum has poor damage but he is a beast in keeping anyone that tries to jump his team. 

So in essence what makes tank a threat is; Durability and threat, which include CC, utility and damage. the difference between Vanguards and wardens is that the former favor damage and the latter utility but that is not really something absolute.
If you don't want tanks to do damage, would you like tanks CCing you every five seconds? Because that's what is gonna happen.

That is not the issue. Some like Rammus do deal damage yes, some shield allies like Braum and others like Sejuani Slow the crap out of the enemy team. So no, I don't want Tanks to be CC bot's to but have their durability be prioritised because their niche.
If someone's immensely durable but isn't  threatening, they're useless.

But there's more ways than damage to be "threatening".  That's the whole point of the difference between a juggernaut and a tank.  Hard engage, for example, is not useless even if you rely on teammates to finish off the target.  Same for peel.  Tanks should have non-damage value, which often comes as CC but could be in other ways (e.g. Shen ult).

Basically as I see it there are four main dimensions of a champion's power: damage, durability, mobility and utility.  Nobody can be good at too many, but different champions and classes are good at different ones.  Durability is sometimes called "tankiness" but tanks actually aren't the only class that has high durability, juggernauts do too.  Tanks have high durability and utility, usually low damage, and may or may not have some mobility but not Yasuo/Kalista/Kassadin level.  Juggernauts have high damage and durability, bad mobility and usually very little utility.

So you can't have *just* durability, but there are multiple other things you can have that can make you useful while you're not dying.

So it's going to be a choice of having tanks do some sort of damage, or having tanks be ridiculous CC monsters, or having tanks give massive buffs to their teammates. I think the first is the least frustrating.
